text: In the 1800s, school was very different from today. Many children learned in one-room schoolhouses, where one teacher taught all ages together. Students sat on wooden benches and used little individual chalkboards instead of notebooks. They learned reading, writing, and math, often by memorizing facts. Some kids had to walk miles to school, even in the snow and rain. Not all children went to school—many had to help their families at home or on farm. Teachers were strict, and students had to follow rules carefully. Even though school was hard, many children were happy to learn and dreamed of a better future.
question: Did every child in the 1800s get to go to school?
